questions.text: What does Maggie Bennett do for a living?
questions.explanation:
Bar owner.

	Maggie Bennett owns a popular bar in Garrison. After she moved out of the ranch, Maggie moved into an Airstream behind the bar. She set up a garden next to her Airstream where she grows "kale". In the season finale, Maggie left town after deciding to move back to the ranch with Beau and the boys.

questions.text: Who plays patriarch, Beau Bennett, in "The Ranch"?
questions.explanation:
Sam Elliot.

	Beau Bennett was in 4-H when he was a kid. After returning from Vietnam he went to work on his grandparents ranch and never left. He is separated from his wife, Maggie Bennett. His two sons, Jameson and Colt, live with him on the ranch.

questions.text: What is the theme song for "The Ranch"?
questions.correct: Mamma, Don't Let Your Babies Grow Up To Be Cowboys
questions.explanation:
Mamma, Don't Let Your Babies Grow Up To Be Cowboys.

	Ryeland Allison arranged all the music for the first season of "The Ranch". Ryeland's credits include "Iron Man" and "Madagascar" among others. "Mamma, Don't Let Your Babies Grow Up To Be Cowboys" was initially written and performed by Ed Bruce.

questions.text: What is the name of the ranch that is featured in the Netflix series, "The Ranch"?
questions.explanation:
Iron River Ranch.

	The name of the ranch is shown during the opening credits of the series. The Iron River Ranch is run by Beau Bennett and his sons.

questions.text: What sport did Colt Bennett play semi-pro?
questions.explanation:
Football.

	Right before Colt arrived at Iron River Ranch, he had just returned from Canada where he played for the Saskatoon Cold.  "I was playing for the Saskatoon Cold. It's like the Miami Heat 'cept you know cold." Quote from Colt Bennett.

questions.text: Maggie Bennett, matriarch of the Bennett family, is played by whom?
questions.explanation:
Debra Winger.

	Debra Winger played Maggie Bennett in the first season of "The Ranch". She is known for her roles in "An Officer and a Gentleman" and "Terms of Endearment". At the end of season one, Maggie disappeared after telling Beau she was packing her things to move back to the ranch.

questions.text: What is the name of the town "The Ranch" is centered around?
questions.explanation:
Garrison.

	While the theme song is playing, the town sign for Garrison is shown with a population of 512. Abby works as a teacher at Garrison High School and Rooster is a coach.

questions.text: What nickname does Jameson Bennett go by on "The Ranch"?
questions.explanation:
Rooster.

	Jameson Bennett is the oldest of the Bennett boys. He works a coach at Garrison High School and helps his father on the ranch. At the end of the first season, Rooster was dating the mother of Colt's twenty-three year old girlfriend.

questions.text: What career does Colt's ex-girlfriend Abby have?
questions.explanation:
Teacher.

	Abby is a teacher at Garrison High School. She used to teach Colt's new girlfriend when she was in high school. Abby and Colt dated throughout their high school years. At the end of the season, Abby was engaged to her boyfriend, Kenny, who she has been dating for five years.

questions.text: In the first season of "The Ranch", Cole Bennett remarked about two country music singers he met while he was playing football. Which one had him thrown out of a bar?
questions.explanation:
Taylor Swift.

	In the first episode of "The Ranch", Cole told his father and brother about the chance meeting with Shania Twain after his naked lower half bumped into her in Canada. Later, Cole told Rooster that Taylor Swift had him thrown out of a bar after he introduced himself.
